Title: Sr. Software Engineer - Data Services, Apple Media Products
Description:
Summary
Posted: Apr 11, 2020
Role Number:200143578
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The Apple Media Products (iTunes) Data Services Team is looking for extraordinary engineers to design and build best of breed systems for dealing with our complex and ever-growing data and infrastructure needs. We are a key part of the Apple ecosystem, supporting millions of users and billions of transactions. We’re looking for someone ready to work at huge scale and have a hand in bringing amazing new products and services to market. We partner with a variety of cross and multi-functional team members from a diverse array of groups across the company. You will join a hands-on development team that fosters creativity and generates novel solutions to deliver engineering excellence. Do you want to be a part of an innovative, impactful team making a difference?
Key Qualifications
At least 2 years of professional software development experience in Java and/or C++ with Object oriented concepts and design
Experience and understanding of Kafka
Experience with scalable data stores like Cassandra, Redis, and/or Voldemort
Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs and services. gRPC is a plus
Experiences with large code bases
Strong production debugging and performance tuning skills
Strong understanding of data architecture and related problems
Experience working on complex problems and distributed systems where scalability and performance are extremely important (every millisecond counts)
You should be independent and able to effectively work with multi-functional teams
Our customers love what we do at Apple and we want the same from our engineers - passion for building the best systems!
Description
The Apple Media Products Engineering team supports tens of millions of pieces of content in more than 150 markets enjoyed by hundreds of millions of users, which powers various features within the Apple client applications - App Store, Apple Music, Apple TV+, iTunes, iBooks, Podcast, etc. We’ve got unique and growing needs for data storage and consumption. You will help building the next generation infrastructure and platform services using structured and unstructured storage, caching, queueing, and much more. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with various AMP teams, from store and commerce through to search and recommendations, creating platforms and pipelines that can rapidly scale to serve personalized and non-personalized data with very low latency. You should be someone who is not afraid to question assumptions, is a standout colleague under tight deadlines, and takes on problems with elegant technical solutions.
Education & Experience
Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science. Masters preferred.
Additional Requirements
Experience with compute/container platforms such as AWS EC2, K8s is highly preferred Experience in UI/UX and AngularJS is a plus Experience in distributed data store replication and CRDT is a plus

Title: Presales, Business Development
Description:
Job Description:

Senior Sales Engineer/Solution Architect – Voltage Data Lifecycle & Protection
Responsible for defining, developing & supporting the technical sales process for large enterprise deals providing solutions for data security, data privacy, and data discovery. Work closely with aligned account teams to become trusted advisors to enterprise accounts in the designated territory. Engage with product management, professional services, customer success, and other aspects of the organization to bring clear communication and proof of value to prospects and customers. Leverage technical expertise across the organization to convey a compelling vision for how our solutions will add significant value within the enterprise accounts. Responsible for technical pre-sales consulting work with customers in selling and supporting company solutions and services to set customers up for success. Provides technical support in sales presentations, product demonstrations, POC’s, and initial customer training.
Responsibilities:
Provide Sales Engineering support to new and existing customers as key member of the Data Lifecycle & Protection field sales team.
Liaise with C-level executives, Business & Technical leaders (e. g. CISOs, CIOs, Chief Data Officers, Architects, DBAs, etc.) during pre-sales engagements.
Manage the successful design, execution, and presentation of results for highly technical POCs
Convey solutions, customer stories, and architecture vision using excellent verbal and written communication skills
Assist in the responses to RFIs and RFPs
Provide feedback internally to enhance the product, processes, solutions and knowledge base including authoring papers and creating technical materials as needed
Build authentic relationships with prospects, customers, partners, and the internal team
Work with partners including global systems integrators as a mentor and subject matter expert advisor
Consistently documenting and updating Salesforce CRM (as required) throughout the engagement process with prospects, customers, and partners
Education and Experience Required:
Technical Bachelor's degree preferred
Typically 10+ years of experience in technical consultative selling and account management
Clear understanding of structured and unstructured data, application architecture, and an array of systems including cloud, open systems, and big data.
Experience in encryption and key management principles and technologies
Experience with big data (e.g. Hadoop) and associated technology preferred
Previous programming experience (C/C++,. Net, Java, etc.), comfortable with some programming
Proven Sales Engineering experience working with a team to close enterprise accounts and help drive customer success
Knowledge and Skills Required:
Has a solid understanding of selling enterprise security software
Displays excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
Exceptionally strong presentation and technical evangelizing skills
Familiarity with Oracle, Teradata, SQL, DB2, Hadoop, Apache NiFi, Kubernetes, database configuration and programming on UNIX and Windows systems
Demonstrates solid understanding of enterprise application infrastructure (Web Servers, Application Servers, Databases, SOA, Web Services, Messaging, Containers, etc.)
Well versed or able to quickly ramp up with Key Management and Encryption technologies and quickly establishes thought leadership with customers in this area
Knowledge of PCI DSS, GDPR, CCPA and other regulatory standards that deal with privacy and the protection of PII, PCI, and PHI data is preferred
Has an excellent grasp of enterprise integration challenges
Appropriately tailors communications to varying levels of customer management
Active listener who builds trust in gathering information regarding customer needs, environmental requirements, architecture, and key drivers
Leverages strong understanding of the competition - both positioning strategy and technology - to create competitive advantage Data Lifecycle & Protection solutions
The Unique Value of Micro Focus Voltage Data Lifecycle & Protection
At Micro Focus we provide our customers with a best-in-class portfolio of enterprise-grade scalable software with analytics built in. We put customers at the center of our innovation and build high quality products that our teams can be proud of.
In the Voltage pillar we are leaders in the area of data security, data privacy, and data discovery. Our Voltage Security solutions protect the data itself such that when the data is stolen, it has no value in the hands of the attacker. Voltage pioneered data centric encryption and tokenization with the largest implementations in the world spanning financial services, payments, insurance, telecommunications, healthcare, transportation, retail, and more.
Through our breadth of solutions, we are uniquely positioned to help our customers solve business problems and deliver against the needs and opportunities of Hybrid IT, from mainframe to mobile to cloud. We are a pure-play software company with a level of focus that other technology companies do not have, we are designed from the ground up to build, sell and support software.
Job:
Sales

Micro Focus is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Title: Global Pricing Insights and Strategy; Manager/Senior Manager
Description:
American Express invites you to share your resume so you can be considered for future Manager/Senior Manager-level opportunities in the New York based Global Merchant Services organization.

The Global Merchant Services (GMS) Pricing team is responsible for the single largest source of American Express’ revenue: Merchant Discount Revenue. The team works closely with multiple business partners to determine the optimal pricing to encourage merchant acceptance of American Express, while striving to improve coverage and merchant satisfaction. Ultimately, we drive GMS revenue and profit growth through customer-centric pricing principles, more flexible pricing architecture and innovative pricing solutions
The Manager/Senior Manager of Global Insights and Strategy is responsible for providing competitive pricing analysis to be used in merchant negotiations as well as develop subject matter expertise in competitive pricing practices and trends. This global role provides a unique opportunity to have impact across multiple businesses and geographies.
Job Responsibilities:
Build and maintain a global, best in class view of competitive network and acquirer pricing through research, analysis and modeling
Create compelling, merchant facing materials for all regions, which articulate and quantify the American Express value proposition
Develop subject matter expertise on competitive pricing practices and trends, monitor and disseminate changes in payments industry and analyze business and account level impact
Develop innovative ways to articulate and quantify the value American Express delivers to merchants
Partner closely with Client Management teams to provide strategic and analytical support on negotiations
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Minimum Qualifications


Minimum 2+ years experience in financial services industry, payments, and/or other finance related roles, 4+ years of experience is preferred
Bachelor’s degree is required. MBA is a plus
Excellent strategic thought leadership and comfort working with unstructured problems
Proactive nature with close attention to detail and solid project management skills
A passion for high quality and responsiveness to internal customers
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment, which places a premium on driving results
Creative thinker who is willing to question traditional ways of doing things and develop new approaches to old challenges
Strong project management skills with full ownership from analysis through to implementation
Excellent communication skills – both written and oral - with experience leading discussions with Senior Leaders where decisions need to be made based on the facts presented
Strong aptitude for analytics; demonstrated ability to develop sophisticated financial models and draw value-added insights from large amounts of data
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

Title: VP Human Resources Enterprise Group
Description:
About Nice
NICE (Nasdaq: NICE) is the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions that empower organizations to make smarter decisions based on advanced analytics of structured and unstructured data. Over 25,000 organizations in more than 150 countries, including over 85 of the Fortune 100 companies, are using NICE solutions.
Dual HQ in Hoboken New Jersey and Raanana Israel, with 6800 employees located around the globe in more than 35 countries.


About the EG Organization:
The Enterprise Group is a strategic group that holds End-to-end ownership from Innovation to Operations for all of the Enterprise lines of business. This includes Product Strategy & Product Management, Research & Development, Implementation Services, Support Services, Value Realization Services and Cloud Operations.
The strategic goals of the EG are to create relentless innovation, leverage an integrated portfolio, accelerate cloudification and at all times promote customer experience and customer centricity.
The Enterprise Group organization includes 2700 employees covering all functions (Sales, R&D, Professional Services etc.) who are based in 34 countries throughout the world.

Vice President of Human Resources, EG Organization
The HR VP for the Enterprise Group is critical member of the Enterprise Group Leadership Team and is responsible to lead and drive the EG organization people agenda. The main purpose of this role is to support the alignment of organizational and people capabilities with the business strategy and needs; to maximize leadership skills; to build a scalable capability to enable both organic and non-organic growth; to promote employee experience with a robust organizational climate aimed to attract, develop and retain the right talent for the organization.
The HR VP is also a member of the NICE HR Leadership Team and is therefore a significant contributor in shaping HR practices and processes across NICE.
The role reports to the NICE HR Executive VP and is matrixed to the EG President.
Location: Hoboken New Jersey.
Main Responsibilities:
Oversee, lead and execute the EG Human Resources agenda
HR Business Partner to the EG President and the EG Executive Team.
Lead the HR strategy and operation, advise on organizational design and drive change management
Lead and execute employee-related programs and processes to drive a culture of success
Lead day-to-day HR processes, practices and initiatives, including coaching leaders and managers, building winning teams, managing performance, succession planning, employee engagement, career management, work force planning, learning, employee relations, onboarding, working environment, recognition and more.
Assess ongoing organizational & people implications and implement the needed HR approaches and actions
Identify and hire senior leaders
Lead EG HR quarterly business reviews, managing HR analytics and providing insights
Lead future M&As (Due Diligences and PMIs) that will be integrated into NICE EG Organization
Manage a large global team of HRBPs & HR Operations
Drive people policies and ensure compliance to local labor law and global practices

Qualifications:
A minimum of 15 years of HR experience, with at least 3 years of executive HR experience and at least 5 years of international HR experience.
Experience working in complex, matrix and global environment – a must
Experience in the Software Industry – a significant advantage
Experience in M&A
Strong organizational development background
Experience managing global HR teams
Broad and deep experience as an HR Business leader with knowledge of change management, organizational development, talent management, performance management, compensation and workforce management
MSc/MA/MBA in business, HR, social sciences or related field
Competencies:
High accountability, self-driven and proactive approach
High influence skills, high energy and positive can-do approach
Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement
Methodological, practical, fast paced and biased action and "doing" while view the big picture, maintain direction, shape the organization
Strong analytic ability and skills, using data and metrics to evaluate needs, identify trends, drive change and measure impact
Passionate about both business and people
High level of emotional maturity, resilience, adaptability and resourcefulness
Very “Hands on” and detail oriented
High level of communication skills - sharp, crisp, direct, clear, engaging
Ability to establish credibility and build trust
Assertive and persuasive with sound judgment and influence
Ambitious, proactive, inner drive and hard worker
Strong organization skills, including setting priorities, planning, structuring project deliverables and problem solving

Title: Social Media & Community Management Intern
Description:
Description :
Nonviolence International - New York (NVI-NY) seeks to reduce the use of violence by identifying its root causes, developing policy recommendations to combat the misuse of weapons and human right violations, promoting the rule of law and advocating for the inclusiveness of all stakeholders in effecting change.
Nonviolence has proven to be one of the most effective tools to deal with violence, oppression, and discrimination. Nonviolence is based on the conviction that the use of violence (even in the face of violence) is counterproductive to achieve an outcome. Rather, nonviolence is understood as an essential means to achieve political and social change through the empowerment of individuals and civil society, cooperating with each other to ensure peace, justice, and prosperity for all. A nonviolent approach towards social change involves using open and transparent communication, community building and governance to maximize the cooperation between all sectors of society resulting in inclusive and effective solutions.
We are all here to work together to achieve these goals. By joining the NVI Family, you are joining an international network of people who truly care and experts who have positively impacted whole regions using these nonviolent actions methods. You will be joining one of our numerous programs here in NYC, and we will be working together to support one of our partners and further the cause, and we will move that much forward toward a nonviolent world.
ResponsibilitiesYou will be responsible for creating content, craft copy for posts, respond to comments, answer questions and much more as the brand. Social media managers, more often than not, deal with people who have a relationship with, or have heard of, the brand.The Social Media Manager drives the strategy and day-to-day execution of social media, affiliate, influencer, and ambassador channels. Playing a key role in building brand affinity and reach, this role serves as the leader for all things social, driving the brand’s social media reach and roadmap forward with rich, engaging content and creative new tactics. As part of the brand marketing team, this individual will be responsible for planning, strategy and execution to support brand goals of shifting perception, new client acquisition and retention.
In this role, this multitalented creative will help support key brand and business objectives leveraging social, influencer, and affiliate channels to drive impact primarily in the following areas: create word of mouth moments through their channels to drive awareness and acquisition; help drive retention initiatives through new and innovative programming; bring the brand to life through social/content channels with an eye on surprise and delight.
Responsibilities :
include personally following up with prospects, booking appointments and selling memberships according to the sales systems. The incumbent will also be responsible for the implementation and retention with community marketing, external outreach, relationship building, creating systems for quality assurance, strategic planning and staff development.
Implements and communicates a retention and growth strategy that uses NVI-NY forthcoming program offerings as an opportunity to engage and grow our member audience.
Executes the aforementioned strategic plan, paying particular attention to segmenting member base according to emotional state instead rather than mere willingness to pay, and differentially engaging member segments to better address these emotional needs.
Creates a process that allows for continual data gathering to facilitate segmentation.
Leads the membership program to reach audience and revenue goals on an annual basis, particularly in the upcoming years of projected growth following the opening of expanded gallery spaces; tracking and interpreting key performance indicators and adjusting strategy accordingly.
Improves the metrics measuring engagement by members to event attendance, shopping, giving, opening and engaging with content, etc.), ultimately leading to improved retention. Works alongside the other members create and execute a cohesive overall fundraising strategy that strengthens relationships between NVI-NY. Cultivates relationships with NVI-NY members at all levels through interaction at member events and special hours and correspondence via phone and email.
Requirements:
Provide links to 1-3 social networking profiles to demonstrate interest and knowledge
Possesses skills in writing, presentation, interpersonal relations, and customer management
Performs well in environment that values creativity, flexibility, and variety
Exhibits personal qualities, such as open-mindedness, enthusiasm, and adaptability
Prefers challenges, fast pace, new ideas, future focus, and unstructured environment
Job Type: Internship
Experience:
Community Outreach: 1 year (Preferred)
Social Media: 1 year (Preferred)
Social Media Management: 1 year (Preferred)
Community Relations: 1 year (Preferred)
Social Media Monitoring: 1 year (Preferred)
Social Networking: 1 year (Preferred)
Social Media Measurement: 1 year (Preferred)
Education:
Associate (Preferred)
Work Location:
Multiple locations

Title: Systems Engineering Java Developer (Full Stack) - Senior Con...
Description:
Systems Engineering Java Developer (Full Stack) - Senior Consultant

CORE BUSINESS OPERATIONS
Core Business Operations (CBO) is an integrated set of offerings that addresses our clients' core business issues. CBO provides a gamut of consulting services spanning advisory, implementation and operations. CBO practitioners help our clients transform, modernize, and run their existing technology platforms right from process design to implementation and finally ensuring roll-out transition.

CBO has four different offerings — Systems Engineering focused on design, delivery and support of large scale software applications and integrated systems; Cloud Engineering focused on end-to-end cloud services from migration strategy into transformation and cloud operations; Core Industry Solutions focused on industry vertical, sector specific solutions that drive operational change and automate the core of the business; and Operations Transformation focused on creating a flexible, innovative business model for clients supported by a strong operations foundation. CBO serves clients across Life Sciences and Health Care, Government & Public Services and Financial Services among other industries.

SYSTEMS ENGINEERING
At Deloitte Consulting LLP, our Systems Engineering specialists help clients manage the complexity inherent with technology change, from requirements planning to architecture, testing to deployment, and beyond, helping to link their IT programs to organizational goals. And we offer a complete range of industry-leading services, including systems development, solution and platform integration. Learn more about our Systems Engineering practice.

SENIOR CONSULTANT
As a Senior Consultant at Deloitte Consulting, you will be responsible for leading the design, development and deployment of large-scale complex software solutions at an enterprise level. These applications are often high-volume mission critical systems and would provide you an exposure to a broad range of technologies across all layers of architecture in the Java J2EE technology stack. You will be responsible for independently lead the team and mentor junior team members, collaborating team across shores to understand the functional requirements and translate them into work products. You will be involved in end-to-end delivery of the project from estimations, planning and execution. You would also be responsible for tracking status and collecting metrics for analysis.

Work you’ll do
Lead and drive discussions with business and functional analysts and come up with technical architecture and design and help the team shape requirements and resolve ambiguities.
Understand the impacts of adapting different architectures and designs and present the same to all relevant stakeholders. Manage both functional and technical requirements while deciding on technical solutions.
Develop solutions following established technical design, application development standards and quality processes in projects.
Manage project execution by defining the work-breakdown structure in accordance with the master project plan and track the progress.
Establish technical design / development guidelines, templates and standards and ensure that the team follows them.
Run the daily calls / scrum meetings with respect to deliverables and build the weekly status reports to be reviewed with leadership.
Perform detailed reviews on deliverables. Provide technical guidance to the team members.
Interact with other stakeholders not limited to end-user clients, Project Manager/Scrum master, Business Analysts, offshore development, testing and other cross-functional teams.

The team
CBO practitioners work on design, delivery and support of a variety of solutions that help our clients meet business objectives. These solutions range from large scale ground-up custom developed applications, to cloud based development and integration services as well as customizing industry sector focused packages. As a Java/J2EE capability hire on this team, you would get opportunities to work on all adjacent area technologies such as user interface/user experience development, integration services, business rules engine solutions, or cloud based service.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

Prior Experience:
7 to 10 years of hands on technical experience on web / application development using Java / JEE technology stack.

Skills / Project Experience - required:
Strong conceptual knowledge in OOPS, Core Java, Collections, Multithreading.
Experience on Web Technologies JSP, Servlets.
Experience with working on any one of the web frameworks: Spring, Struts etc. and on data access frameworks like JDBC, Hibernate etc.
Experience on web/application servers (Tomcat, Jboss etc.).
Experience with webservice development (SOAP / REST)
Experience on any of the JMS/Messaging tools like Apache ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, Message Brokers, Kafka, etc.
Ability to write build/configuration scripts using Build tools (Ant, Maven and scripting) and code configuration tools (Subversion, Github, Perforce etc.).
Experience with UML (Class, Sequence, Domain Model) and on various design patterns
Ability to work with automated unit test frameworks like Junit and drive end-to-end testing of modules.
Ability to write SQL with complex joins on RDBMS and usage of database functions or unstructured databases like MongoDB
Ability to communicate clearly across teams in the project and having excellent verbal and written communication skills for articulating architecture and design principles.
Experience managing medium size teams
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Skills / Project Experience - good to have:
Experience with Micro services development using spring boot or any other technology framework.
Experience on Agile/Scrum based delivery.
Experience in different architectural designs for complex enterprises.
Industry recognized Technology Certification.
Travel at 80% (While 80% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)

How you’ll grow
At Deloitte, we’ve invested a great deal to create a rich environment in which our professionals can grow. We want all our people to develop in their own way, playing to their own strengths as they hone their leadership skills. And, as a part of our efforts, we provide our professionals with a variety of learning and networking opportunities—including exposure to leaders, sponsors, coaches, and challenging assignments—to help accelerate their careers along the way. No two people learn in exactly the same way. So, we provide a range of resources including live classrooms, team-based learning, and eLearning. DU: The Leadership Center in India, our state-of-the-art, world-class learning Center in the Hyderabad offices is an extension of the Deloitte University (DU) in Westlake, Texas, and represents a tangible symbol of our commitment to our people’s growth and development. Explore DU: The Leadership Center in India

Benefits
At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

Deloitte’s culture
Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture that is inclusive, invites authenticity, leverages our diversity, and where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.

Corporate citizenship
Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.

Title: US Tax Reporting and Compliance Senior Manager
Description:
Reporting to the Director of Americas Tax, the primary responsibilities for this role will be leading the US corporate income tax provision and compliance processes. The position will co-direct a team of tax professionals and work closely with the UK-based global tax reporting team and external service providers.
This role is responsible for supporting the preparation of the global corporate income tax provision by reviewing and preparing US specific schedules and calculations (federal and state), interacting with the outside audit firm, and managing roles, responsibilities and deadlines for the half-year and annual close process. This role is also responsible for management of domestic income tax compliance obligations, including preparation of federal and state income tax filings and estimated/extension payments. This individual will perform income tax research, participate in income tax planning initiatives and support domestic income tax audits.
Description of Overall Responsibilities:
Global Corporate Income Tax Reporting Responsibilities
Work with the global tax reporting team to establish a provision process for US federal and state income taxes in accordance with IFRS accounting standards that includes:
Calculation of current and deferred income tax expense.
Maintenance of an inventory of deferred tax assets and liabilities.
Reconciliation of income tax payable.
Analysis and maintenance of an inventory of uncertain tax positions.
Draft technical memos and other documentation to support reporting positions.
Domestic Income Tax Compliance
Project management of US federal and state income tax returns, including planning for and developing overall return calendar and coordination of timing and inputs with other tax team members.
Review of US federal and state income tax returns.
Research and document income tax accounting methods, tax positions and processes.
Preparation of quarterly estimated tax calculations and extensions.
Support of IRS and state income tax audits.
Keep up-to-date on tax law and their organizational impact; provide training and updates for team on changes in tax law.
Other Responsibilities
Develop and maintain relationships with operational and finance leaders.
Liaise with finance/controllership to ensure smooth, reliable and predictable budget and close process.
Maintain and refine the information gathering process to most efficiently obtain the required data.
Understand cash flows/needs (ie, dividends, loan repayments) within the organization to ensure tax planning is reported accurately.
Work closely with the strategic tax and transfer pricing tax teams to ensure that tax strategies are accurately reported.
Train and mentor team members.
Manage and support special projects as needed.
Drive automation and process improvement initiatives.
Forecast taxable income for purposes of internal budgeting (cash tax estimates and reconciliations).
Develop and implement processes for compliance responsibilities
Travel requirement is ~10%.
Candidate Profile
Minimum of 8 years overall experience.
Strong hands-on experience working with tax provisions.
Strong income tax accounting and compliance experience.
CPA and/or Masters of Tax preferred.
Familiarity with OneSource income tax preferred.
Ability to train and develop junior staff.
Process oriented individual that focuses on substantiating and documenting calculations/filing positions.
Desire to work in a dynamic environment where things are constantly changing and evolving.
Required Competencies
Conscientiousness – thorough, diligent and accountable to others; takes ownership for their work Self-directed – able to handle ambiguity and thrive in an unstructured environment Manage, document and improve complex processes Mentoring junior staff Commitment to professional growth
Reference ID: https://convatec.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/ConvaTec/job/US---Bridgewater-NJ/US-Tax-Reporting-and-Compliance-Senior-Manager_JR00002142
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Public Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)

Title: Divisional Controller
Description:
Cactus Holdings Inc., is looking to hire a Divisional Controller to oversee general accounting operations by verifying our financial transactions. The Divisional Controller’s responsibilities include reconciling account balances and bank statements, maintaining general ledger and preparing month-end, quarter and year end close procedures. The Divisional Controller’s duties also include ensuring accuracy and effectiveness in all of our accounting tasks. The Divisional Controller will need to demonstrate the ability to work proactively and independently in a fast-paced office environment. The Divisional Controller will report to the CFO.
This is an ideal role for someone with an entrepreneurial mindset who is excited about being relevant in helping a company grow. Due to the growth of the organization in an unstructured way, the ideal candidate would be excited about the possibility of making a difference and help implement structure using GAAP to create system and best practices.
Why choose a career with Cactus Holdings, Inc.?
Cactus Holdings, Inc. employs over 1,800 people and owns over 2 Million square feet in NYC Real Estate, with over 75 properties, management, development, affordable housing and virtually debt free! We serve over 1,000 weekly wholesale customers and our retail locations serve over 900K people weekly. We are expanding and looking for the right candidate to join our team.
Responsibilities
Produce accounting reports and present their results
Prepare and examine accounting records, financial statements, taxes, and other financial reports
Filing the company's 1099, Census and Benchmarks
Reconcile cash and assist with internal control improvement
Deposit reconciliation for retail, wholesale, and real estate
Maintain regular relationships with financial institutions
Credit card feed and chargeback allocation, reconciliation, and analysis
Partner with IT on system improvements/automation
Maintain calendar ensuring key dates are met (e.g. tax deadlines)
Analyze financial information and summarize financial status
Spot errors and suggest ways to improve efficiency and spending
Provide technical support and advice on Management Reporting
Review and recommend modifications to accounting systems and procedures
Participate in financial standards setting and in forecast process
Assist with tax audits and tax returns
Assist with internal and external audits to ensure compliance
Verify, allocate, post and reconcile accounts payable and receivable
Support month-end, quarterly and year-end close process
Qualifications:
BS degree in Accounting, Finance or relevant
Proven experience (7+ years) as an Assistant Controller
Thorough knowledge of basic accounting procedures
In-depth understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
Familiarity with financial accounting statements
Experience with general ledger functions and the month-end quarter and year-end close process
Hands-on experience with accounting software packages, similar to FreshBooks and QuickBooks
Advanced MS Excel skills including Vlookups, filters and pivot tables
Accuracy and attention to detail
Aptitude for numbers and quantitative skills
Relevant certification (e.g. CMA or CPA) a plus
Ability to work with all levels of management and associates
Able to present financial data in a concise, logical and useful manner
Ability to think proactively and work in a highly collaborative and high paced environment
Must embody and demonstrate company values and cultureAccounting/Finance

Title: Senior Client Service Associate
Description:
Description
At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day
First Republic Private Wealth Management is comprised of investment management, brokerage, trust, financial planning and insurance professionals. We offer customized wealth management solutions for our clients from a wide array of services including comprehensive investment management, financial planning, estate planning, trust services, endowment management and more. Our goal is to understand our clients' unique needs and support them throughout a lifetime of financial goals.

Responsibilities
See service from a higher perspective
As a SeniorClient Service Associate, you will be the first point of contact for clients or prospects, providing a wide range of sales, service, administrative and relationship management support to assigned wealth advisors and investment professionals across Registered Investment (RIA), Broker-Dealer and Trust or other teams.

What you'll do as a SeniorClient Service Associate:
Provide sales and service support for current clients and prospects.
Research and respond to inquiries of high net worth clients; escalate issues as appropriate.
- Oversee client interaction - act as a conduit between client and Private Wealth Management operations; create business plans geared toward client growth; build relationships with clients by initiating contact and making frequent office visits; introduce technology and services to clients as appropriate; cross sell products, services and/or technology; monitor client investing and understand their rationale, intentions and goals.
Assist with phone calls to prospects and clients, manage meeting logistics, submit business expense requests, schedule appointments and distribute mail.
Place equity, mutual fundand fixed income trades for brokerage clients; as necessary, utilize custodial websites, CRM client database and APX portfolio management system.
Assist with completion and transmission of transaction documents and communicate with operations/billing/internal departments/First Republic Securities Company and other custodians regarding transaction processing follow-up.

Qualifications
You could be a great fit if you have:
At least three years of related experience, with a bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or related field, or equivalent experience
Required Series 7, 66 (or 63/65 combination)licenses
Exceptional interpersonal skills to interface with clients, prospects, custodians and colleagues
The ability to use considerable tact and discretion when dealing with client or sensitive data
The ability to work independently under minimal supervision, with exceptional problem-solving proficiency
- Excellent organizational, communication (both verbal and written) and client relationship management skills - whether interaction is in-person, over the telephone or via email
Ability and desire to work in a fast-paced sales-oriented environment that can be unstructured; a proven ability to handle pressure, multi-task and prioritize work at all times
Excellent attention to detail and high degree of accuracy and consistency
Working knowledge of the securities industry, with a broad understanding of capital markets and related investment practices
Outstanding skills using personal computers in a Windows-based environment, including Microsoft Office
Experience with Bloomberg, APX or custody system a plus
A desire to understand the Bank's structure and identify opportunities to utilize Bank resources to meet client needs
Job Demands:
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.
Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship.

First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

Title: Cyber Risk Principal
Location: New York, NY 10002 (Lower East Side area)
Description:
Introduction
Promontory Financial Group, LLC, an IBM Company is the premier consulting firm for financial services companies worldwide. Our senior professionals have served as partners of top law firms and leaders of financial regulators and global financial institutions, including positions such as general counsel or chief legal officer. Unlike many law and consulting firms, we focus upon a single core competency: mastery of U.S. and global financial regulation. In this arena, our professionals offer a unique blend of legal, regulatory, and management expertise, and we are generally engaged by the board or senior executives of leading financial institutions to assist with their most pressing, sensitive, and complex assignments.

Your Role and Responsibilities
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with financial services clients to assess their information security/cybersecurity and IT risk management programs against industry best practices and regulatory requirements
Assist financial services clients with transitions to cloud computing platforms and help build compliant cloud governance programs
Lead the development of concrete, actionable roadmaps for improving information security/cybersecurity and IT risk management programs and achieving strategic initiatives (e.g., cloud transformation)
Interface with the client in the strategic design process to translate security and business requirements into technical designs and act as client’s point of contact for engagement delivery on a daily basis and manage small teams dedicated to client delivery
Ability to interact comfortably with Executive Management and Board Members of clients and regulatory authorities generally with a Managing Director
Travel as required to client sites in the United States and internationally. Time spent traveling ranges from 30-100 percent
Performs additional duties as assigned
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Experience working in information security, with a technical understanding of a range of enterprise IT architectures (e.g., web applications, databases, operating systems, server infrastructure, mobile devices, and networking technologies)
Third-party risk experience, including vendor due diligence
Working knowledge of information security controls, guidelines, and standards for financial institutions (e.g., NIST, FFIEC IT Examination handbooks)
Working knowledge of fundamental cloud, security technologies and tooling, and secure software development lifecycle concepts
Understanding of international privacy and data protection regulations, such as CCPA, HIPPA, and GDPR
Superior writing and editing skills with the ability to construct well-founded, clear, and concise analyses and recommendations
Strong attention to detail
Ability to lead and manage day to day aspects of engagement activities and an ability to work with clients
Strong analytical skills
Ability to handle complex information, solve problems, and manage multiple tasks
Ability to communicate effectively with clients and within all levels of the organization
Ability to establish and maintain positive relationships and build teams
Strong reputation for integrity and ethics

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in computer science or a related field
CISSP, CISM, CISA, GIAC, CIPP/US or other security/privacy certifications preferred, but not required
Professional with a minimum of 7-8 years of consulting, financial services industry or government regulatory agency with an information security role
Demonstrated experience in building and managing project teams to address complex issues in high pressure situations
Track record working in an unstructured environment where engagement leaders are expected to identify and develop innovative solutions to client challenge

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
MBA, JD or equivalent industry experience is preferred, but not required.



About Business Unit
IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBM
What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM
IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement
For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM
IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Title: Pre-K or 4th Grade Teacher - P.E. Specialist
Description:
Earn a $125,000 salary and join a team of master teachers at The Equity Project (TEP) Charter School, featured in the New York Times, The Wall Street Journal and on 60 minutes for its revolutionary teacher salaries and its outstanding results.
The Equity Project Charter School's commitment to developing healthy bodies and active lifestyles begins with daily Physical Education classes for all students at every grade level. In this role, you will teach a 45-minute PE period to each of the four Pre-K classes, or five 2nd, 3rd, or 4th grade classes. You will also supervise unstructured play as well as structured activities during recess, ensuring that students are safe but active and on the road to developing the habits that will lead to life-long health.

Requirements: This position requires a minimum of 2 years of lead teaching experience in Pre-K, Kindergarten, 1st, 2nd, 3rd, or 4th Grade.

Compensation: Master teachers earn an annual salary of $125,000. Benefits include medical, dental, vision insurance, 403b retirement plan, STD, LTD and Life Insurance. Individuals in the position also receive all school vacations – approximately 10 weeks per year.
Join us for an VIRTUAL info session!
If you or a friend is interested in applying for a teaching position at TEP, join us for a virtual information session with TEP's Principal Zeke Vanderhoek. Learn more about the teacher application process and what it's like to teach at TEP.

Please RSVP here!
To Apply:
The first stage of the process is the application below. In order to be considered, you must submit an application that consists of all four components: 1 - Resume, 2 - Cover letter, 3 - Evidence of student learning, and 4 -Original Curricular tool. The requirements for each of the four components are specified in detail below.
1. RESUME: Please submit an up-to-date resume.
2. COVER LETTER: Please submit a well-written cover letter. Please include information about your experience teaching Physical Education to kindergarten students.
3. EVIDENCE OF STUDENT LEARNING: Submit one of the following three options:
Option A: NEW (DUE TO COVID-19 SCHOOL CLOSURES)
We understand you may be unable to provide a recorded video of you teaching in a classroom setting. If you do not have a video with students in the classroom (per the instructions below) you may still submit a video of yourself teaching. Get creative! You may include a video of you teaching (a) a lesson with/for no students, (b) a lesson of you teaching family members, (c) or a lesson for students virtually. We're excited to see your creativity. The video must be accompanied by a written narrative that analyzes and reflects upon the teaching that occurs in the lesson. There is no minimum or maximum length for the narrative. The video may be submitted in any format, but a link to a video posted online is preferred.
An unedited video clip (maximum 15 minutes) of you teaching in a classroom setting (preferred) or a small-group setting. It is preferred that the students be in the same grade-level as the TEP teaching position for which you are applying, though this is not a strict requirement. The video may contain only one continuous, unedited clip (i.e. do not splice together multiple clips from different points in the lesson). The clip does not need to show an entire lesson; a brief lesson segment is perfectly acceptable. The video must be accompanied by a written narrative that analyzes and reflects upon the teaching and learning that occurs in the lesson and may offer an explanation as to what occurred prior to and subsequent to the clip. There is no minimum or maximum length for the narrative. The video may be submitted in any format, but a link to a video posted online is preferred.
Option B: A portfolio of student work that demonstrates the progress of at least two specific students that you have taught. The portfolio must contain a minimum of two work products for each student (for a minimum of four work products) completed at different points in time during the period when each student was in your class. The portfolio must be accompanied by a written narrative that analyzes and reflects upon the progress that each student demonstrates. There is no minimum or maximum length for the narrative.
Option C: Assessment data for at least one entire class of students that you have taught. The assessments may be standardized national, state, or city assessments or your own self-created assessments. The assessment data can be provided in any form that you choose (official documents with students' last names crossed-out, or documents that you create to summarize student assessment performance). The data you provide should ideally show progress over time; as such, it is recommended (though not required) that you provide data for at least two assessments taken at different points in time. The assessment data must be accompanied by a copy of the assessments themselves. If a specific assessment is unavailable, provide a copy of a similar assessment. The assessment data must also be accompanied by a written narrative that provides background on the assessments, explains how the assessments measure student performance, and analyzes the results of your class. There is no minimum or maximum length for the narrative.
4. ORIGINAL CURRICULAR TOOL: Please submit one original curricular tool of any form that you have personally developed. The requirement here is deliberately open-ended because we are interested in seeing anything that you have developed that you believe has meaningfully supported your students' learning. This may take the form of written materials, a unique instructional methodology, a technological innovation, etc.

#ZR

Title: Director, Strategic Projects (Chief of Staff to CPO)
Description:
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION:
EL Education is redefining student achievement in diverse communities across the country, ensuring that all students master rigorous content, develop positive character, and produce high-quality work. We create great public schools where they are needed most, inspiring teachers and students to achieve more than they thought possible.
EL Education’s portfolio of instructional materials and coaching services draws on decades of deep partnership with schools and districts in our national school network—those implementing our school model—and in our family of literacy partners—those implementing our Language Arts curriculum.
Based on our founding principles of meaningful work, character, and respect for teachers, EL Education’s offerings transform teaching and learning to promote habits of scholarship and character that lead to high student achievement. In addition to success on standardized tests, EL Education students demonstrate critical thinking, intellectual courage, and emotional resilience; they possess the passion and the capacity to contribute to a better world.
EL Education, a 501c(3) nonprofit, was founded in 1992 by Outward Bound USA in collaboration with the Harvard Graduate School of Education.
For more information, visit ELeducation.org
ABOUT THE POSITION:
Reporting to the Chief Partnerships Officer, the Director, Strategic Projects (Chief of Staff) will work internally to solve problems, mediate and deal with issues before they are brought to the Chief Partnership Officer and act as an advisor to the Chief. This new role will be instrumental in developing and refining the systems to support impact in our work with a diverse set of school and district level partnerships, and creating, maintaining, and reporting dashboards with the team’s key performance indicators (KPI’s). This role also will serve as the primary point of contact for our partner facing team, with other departments across the organization.
Ideal candidates possess a deep commitment to ensuring equitable outcomes for all students, and core competencies in multiple forms of communication, problem solving and analysis, informal/relational leadership, and project and program management.
Estimated travel: 30% on average (examples of travel may include: Examples of travel, partner relations, internal team meetings, internal leadership meetings with colleagues)
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Organize and prioritize key information, issues, deadlines, and decisions
Lead projects that are team wide priorities as well as projects requiring strategic analysis and data consolidation that span across multiple departments within the organization
Monitor key performance indicators and streamline communication and priorities for the partnership team
Build strong working relationships across the partnership team, as well as with departments across the organization to maximize collaboration, problem solving and generate solutions to deliver on impact outcomes and meet or exceed revenue goals
Central point of contact for high priority initiatives and information requests
Assist in development and execution of strategies and initiatives to drive team efficiencies
Work together with the CPO to strategize and develop presentations for internal and external meetings
Build impactful and comprehensive presentations for review with senior leadership team
Plan, coordinate and streamline a variety of internal team meetings
Coordinate and streamline communication structures and routines and consistently monitor for efficacy
Cross departmental liaison for CPO and Partnership team
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:
The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:
Demonstrated strategic thinking and analytical skills, ideally with 5+ years of experience in strategic analysis, consulting, communications and/or project management related roles
Superior project management and organizational skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, with great follow-up and attention to detail, and work well in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Strong drive and high personal accountability to deliver results within tight time frames; ability to prioritize effectively when faced with changing priorities
Superior written and verbal communication skills, including ability to storyboard presentations
Excellent relationship and influencing skills for dealing with a wide range of issues and people at different levels in the organization
Creative problem solver who can manage tasks and projects autonomously with minimal supervision
Energetic, curious, self-motivated, proactive and able to work well under pressure and in an unstructured environment
Strong executive presence, maturity, self-awareness, and integrity able to maintain strict confidentiality
Zeal for EL Education's mission and vision of student achievement.
Ability to work effectively with staff of all backgrounds
Knowledge and experience in designing and leading effective team meetings
A commitment to respecting and increasing diversity through inclusive practices
Entrepreneurial approach to this new role.
Willingness and ability to travel up to 30%
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience and a wide variety of benefits, including paid-time-off, 403b match, maternity/paternity leave, medical/dental/vision insurance, etc.
HOW TO APPLY
Please apply online at www.ELeducation.org in the Careers section. No phone calls please. Thank you.

Title: Cloud Spark Developer(Fully Remote)
Description:
Cloud Spark Developer
Remote Position
Job Description –
You will be responsible for design and development of highly available, scalable and distributed data platforms using frameworks to process high volume, high velocity and wide variety of structured and unstructured data. This is a client facing role and candidate is expected to have responsibility for solution design, solving key technical challenges and guiding customer with technical recommendations.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) required
4+ years implementing Big data solutions in data analytics space and a minimum of 2 year of experience in developing applications in Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
AWS Preferred
Experience with Software installation, provisioning and administration
Extensive experience in Object Oriented Programming (Java, Scala, Python), data movement technologies (ETL/ELT), Messaging Technologies (ActiveMQ, Kafka), Relational and NoSQL databases (Cassandra, Spark, Elastic search, Graph database, Stream Processing (Flink, Storm), Java Spring, Web APIs and in-memory technologies
Strong knowledge of developing highly scalable distributed systems using Open source technologies
Experience with DevOps, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (Maven, Jenkins, Stash, Ansible, Docker)
Experience in Agile methodologies (Kanban and SCRUM)
Strong technical design and analysis skills
Ability to take care of ambiguity and work in fast paced environment
Deep experience supporting mission critical applications quickly
Superb communication skills, both through written and verbal channels
Excellent collaboration skills to work with multiple teams in the organization
Ability to understand and adapt to changing business priorities and technology advancements
Strong knowledge and technology trends in implementing of Big data ecosystem
Proven understating of data architecture patterns such as Lambda, Kappa, Event driven Architecture, Data as a Service, Microservice, etc.
Must Have:
AWS
Spark Programming using Scala / Java
Docker
Kubernetes
Access Management Concepts like – RBAC and ABAC
Linux experience including Shell Scripting

Title: Full Stack Developer – Emerging Technology (MDM)
Description:
Since our founding in 1919, The New School (TNS) has redrawn and redefined the boundaries of intellectual and creative thought as a preeminent academic center. Our rigorous, multidimensional approach to education dissolves walls between disciplines and helps nurture progressive minds. At our university, students have the academic freedom to shape their unique, individual paths for a complex and rapidly changing world. Our colleges include Parsons School of Design, Eugene Lang College of Liberal Arts, the College of Performing Arts, The New School for Social Research, the Schools of Public Engagement, and Parsons Paris.
Working at The New School comes with several unique benefits including a generous time off policy and a tuition benefit for employees and their dependents.
The Full Stack Developer (MDM) is an exciting position in the newly created Emerging Technology group in the university IT Department. This group will be focusing on leading edge information technology (IT), delivering innovative and scalable solutions to the university and its external partners. The team will create knowledge and technology to empower The New School by making the campus information systems lighter, smarter, and friendlier.
The Full Stack Developer (MDM) will leverage their expert knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and application development to create strategies and pipelines which facilitate the downstream creation of enterprise data products.
Major Responsibilities
Design and develop durable solutions for the capture, processing, and consumption of enterprise data.
Build out data management processes and integrations of structured and unstructured data.
Create the conditions across all areas of the data lifecycle for meaningful predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Utilize end-to-end understanding of application design principles to inform all aspects of architecture and implementation of solutions.
Drive operational efficiency by identifying opportunities for strategic improvement using emerging technologies.
Maintain in-depth knowledge of IT industry best practices, technologies, architectures, and emerging technologies.
Mentor and knowledge-share with other staff developers
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
3 years of experience with MDM tools such as Informatica, Orchestra, Reltio, Stibo, IBM Initiate, Talend or SAP MDG.
Demonstrated development experience with some combination of the following: Python, R, Java, Ruby, Node.js, REST, SOAP, SQL, PL/SQL, C/C++, JavaScript, PHP, Angular, React, Swift, etc.
Experience working in Oracle, MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL database environments.
Familiarity with co-development environments and source control.
Experience creating and maintaining enterprise architecture supporting emerging technologies including machine learning, Blockchain, and predictive and prescriptive data analytics.
Experience working in small, highly technical teams employing CI/CD and Agile/Scrum practices.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in information technology, science or engineering related field
Hands-on collaboration with a Cloud security technologist
Familiar with higher education information technology.
Familiar with Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, or related technology
Architect certified, e.g. AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Google Professional Cloud Architect.

Title: Business Development Manager, Canada
Description:
Job Advert
Canddates must be Fluent in Mandarin (Written & Oral)
We are welcoming Visa candidates including H1-B Candidates
This role requires to reside in the NJ market-We are absorbing relocation costs.
Responsible for capturing RB brands cross-border business opportunity across nations and design Route to Market model in China and source country, development and implementation of category / cross-border model strategy focusing on strengthening in market performance, driven by across channel presence, optimization of assortment, promotion & pricing;
Identify channel gaps and work out implementation plans for driving our brand presence, build up collaborative relationship with potential CB e-platform / channels and develop qualified distributor / trader across CB model;
Design cross-border route to market strategy for China & source country; Plan trade strategy for new brand launch; Timely review to adjust strategy based on data and solid channel and partner insights;
Manage cross-border distributor / trader / sales agencies for implementation of brand and channel strategies, streamline CB process with internal counterpart for a sustainable business;
Business growth acceleration by partnering with marketing counterparts in developing new brand trade/selling decks & toolkits, building and deploying integrated activation plans in source country targeting the Chinese population.
Manage the daily operation with customers to ensure orders are fulfilled on time and the operation model is constantly optimized.
Contributes to category marketing plans, with customer & category analysis and promotional strategy.
Continuous analysis of the customer’s position/ customer gross margin works together with cross-border source country and local sales execution to recommend in store actions aimed at strengthening our position in the category.
Key contact for the Brand Marketing team with regards to all pricing, promotional and customer activity.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Minimum bachelor's degree in business preferred. 3+ years of sales, trade marketing / business development experience. Should have ecommerce experience, cross-border ecom or Daigou experience is a plus
Prior experience includes working on ecommerce, building an ecom business/brands, working with cross-functional, global teams. International working or international team co-ordination working is required.
Strong creative, analytical, strategic thinking and problem-solving skills. Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in unstructured environments.
Leadership and interpersonal skills capable of building strong working relationships and influencing and customers and internal teams. Strong commercial understanding of business issues/opportunities
Results oriented, entrepreneurial and self-motivating
Ability to think outside the box
Tenacious and resilient, driven to achieve even when faced with obstacles
Be comfortable with working in a high-pressure environment.
Fluent in Mandarin, both spoken and written is mandatory
Equality
In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.
RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

Title: Business Development Manager, LATAM
Description:
Job Advert
Being Fluent in Spanish and/or Portuguese is Preferred.
Identify channel gaps and work out implementation plans for driving our brand presence, build up collaborative relationship with potential CB e-platform / channels and develop qualified distributor / trader across CB model;
Design cross-border route to market strategy for LATAM & source country; Plan trade strategy for new brand launch; Timely review to adjust strategy based on data and solid channel and partner insights;
Manage cross-border distributor / trader / sales agencies for implementation of brand and channel strategies, streamline CB process with internal counterpart for a sustainable business;
Manage the daily operation with customers to ensure orders are fulfilled on time and the operation model is constantly optimized.
Minimum bachelor's degree in business preferred. 4+ years of sales, trade marketing / business development experience. Should have ecommerce experience, cross-border ecom experience is a plus
Prior experience includes working on ecommerce, building an ecom business/brands, working with cross-functional, global teams. International working or international team co-ordination working is required.
Strong creative, analytical, strategic thinking and problem-solving skills. Ability to deal with ambiguity and work in unstructured environments.
Creating new markets and taking advantage of emerging opportunities, you’ll help us drive cross-border eCommerce. You’ll build awareness amongst niche communities. You’ll build brand equity amongst with consumers and get consumers talking about our exciting products. You’ll analyse customer insights and develop communications that engage and connect with people. You’ll understand trends and take advantage of new buyer behaviours to help customers benefit from our leading brand portfolio for themselves.
You’ll love it because…
…you’ll get to make an impact like never before. You’ll be responsible for your own projects - we can’t wait to listen to your ideas. The products you help us get out there will make people’s lives better. Our iconic brands will provide an incredible platform for you. And our dynamic, ownership-driven culture will help bring the very best out of you, every day.

Equality
In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation.
RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

Title: Marketing Operations Manager
Description:
ASG LegalTech – Marketing Operations Manager About ASG LegalTech
ASG LegalTech is a novel and rapidly growing legal technology business that offers a suite of product solutions to allow lawyers to automate their firms, get more done in less time, and focus on what they do best: practicing law. The business currently includes three leading practice management solutions – PracticePanther, Bill4Time, and MerusCase.
ASG LegalTech operates as a single business and team with multiple software solutions. Our software offerings have the ability to scale in different niches of the market, and the shared resources, talent, and expertise allow us to accelerate growth across the portfolio. ASG LegalTech will continue to grow each of these platforms organically, while also looking for new acquisitions that can bolster our position as a leading legal technology company. ASG LegalTech has ~70 employees based in New York, Florida, Washington, California, and other locations across the US, and is part of ASG, a portfolio company of Alpine Investors.
Job Description We are looking for a passionate, analytical, and creative marketing operations manager to further accelerate our growth. You’ll be at the heart of our marketing efforts, working define and own the strategy, processes, metrics, and technology that will enable our organization to target the right buyers, generate high-quality leads, and help move them down the funnel. You will own, administer and build upon our existing websites and marketing technology stack to scale and optimize our marketing efforts and grow our business. This role is highly strategic, analytical and data-oriented and is suited for someone unafraid to work in a rapidly growing startup environment. This role will report directly to the Chief Growth Officer. Responsibilities
Own, administer, optimize and build upon our websites, Salesforce, and marketing automation tool stack
Perform marketing data analysis and translate them into strategic and tactical insights to optimize stages of the conversion funnel
Develop a strategic roadmap for SEO and marketing automation, including implementation of new marketing tools
Own the marketing infrastructure for various automated marketing campaigns, including attribution, campaign workflow, asset development, segmentation, and reporting
Collaborate with marketing team to develop and implement new website content, campaigns (e.g. email marketing), landing pages and demand generation strategies
Optimize nurture paths/email programs at various stages of customer lifecycle
Drive productivity by simplification of processes and implementation of automation tools
Optimize lead to cash end to end workflow efficiency related to Marketing and Sales transactions to and from Salesforce and integrated business applications
Accurately track lead generation through campaign names and CRM reports
Maintain marketing automation best practices including list management, optimization, data quality and hygiene, and troubleshooting
Experience
3+ years of experience in in a fast-paced, demand generation focused marketing organization, ideally at a SaaS company
Experience in website administration and various CMS applications (e.g. Instapage, Wordpress, etc.)
Applicable knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery preferred
Excellent analytical skills and experience measuring data-driven marketing programs
Advanced understanding and use of Google Adwords, Google Webmaster Tools, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager
Knowledge and execution of SEO strategy
Experience integrating Salesforce with other third-party applications such as Zendesk, Intercom, Mailchimp, HubSpot, and Marketo
Google analytics, Salesforce, and HubSpot experience for goals, attribution and BI purposes
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Analytics, Operations, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
Certification in Salesforce preferred
Personal Characteristics
Analytical – can find meaning in numbers, and be a data-driven decision-maker
Excellent communicator – written and oral
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Adept at learning web-based tools
Resourceful. Figures out how to achieve results creatively with finite resources
Thrives in a nimble, lean, unstructured, fast-paced startup
Works collaboratively and energetically
Impeccable integrity and ethical standards. Self-aware, accepting, honest, open, polite and respectful of others
Ability to create and execute on processes for a growing SaaS startup using best practices.
An undying commitment to personal growth and development
Other Information
Location: New York, NY
Compensation: Competitive
Other Benefits: 401k matching, medical, dental and vision healthcare coverage, FSA, subsidized membership to LA Fitness, competitive PTO, sick days, and holidays
PeopleFirst mindset: The guiding principle of our and Alpine SG’s mentality is that the key to success is working with, learning from, and developing exceptional people
Culture: high-energy, fast-moving, passionate atmosphere in a casual, laid back environment
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $85,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year
